p: The result of this study agree with those of Olasope et al. (2016), which reported that fasting blood glucose levels of alloxan-induced diabetic rats significantly decreased upon administration of cocoa powder. In addition, plantain root and stem juices have been reported to lower blood glucose levels ( Omobuwajo et al., 2011). Similar results were also shown in a study by Adedayo et al. (2016), which published the antihyperglycemic properties of certain Musa sp. [ Musa sapientum (Latundan banana), Musa acuminata (Cavendish banana), and Musa acuminate (red Dacca)]. Other plant extracts such as Sargassum hystrix extract, have also been reported to exert significant blood glucose lowering potential ( Gotama et al., 2018). The significant reduction in blood glucose levels in diabetic rats upon daily administration with the formulated beverages may arise from synergistic contribution of both plantain bulb juice and cocoa powder.
